job_title: Facilities Management Supervisor in Saint George, UT
pros: Dixie State is a fast pace, fun place to work and growing like crazy!  The president is very progressive and highly concerned about bringing salaries up to market value and making sure employees feel like he hears us and cares.  Enrollment is at an all time high, as well as construction of new buildings and housing on campus.  Benefits are above par, and they offer free tuition to full time employees and their immediate family members.
cons: Because Dixie State is growing so fast, there are a few growing pains, but all going in the right direction if one can hang on and grow with it.   Older, employees who are stuck in old ways are finding themselves left behind.    Because of this there is some trickle down resistance and damage being done when these employees in positions of authority refuse to keep up with the changes.

job_title: Administrative Support in Saint George, UT
pros: Great area to live in, small campus with great students.
cons: Still thinks small, pays small, and will stay small until they get real university-driven leadership.  I thought I was applying for a part-time position when I saw the pay!

review_title: Great place to work if you don't care about the money.
job_title: Department Secretary in Saint George, UT
pros: Faculty and staff are great to work with.  Great benefits if you are full-time.
cons: Salary is well below similar universities and businesses in the surrounding areas.  There are not very many options for moving up the ladder.

job_title: Adjunct Instructor in Saint George, UT
pros: Friendly campus, students put forth effort to succeed, beautiful campus.
cons: Low salary for adjuncts, no pay for course prep time. Disconnect between full time faculty & adjuncts.  Little opportunity for FT employment as the university tends to hire more adjuncts at < 29 hours.

job_title: Coordinator of Clubs and Service in Saint George, UT
pros:
Wonderful culture, especially in Student Involvement Office.
Culture of wanting employees to progress.
The WEATHER!
Be part of a university destined for growth in student programs, degrees, and services. 
Fun traditions to be a part of--Homecoming, D-Week, Athletics
cons: It is Higher Ed so the pay is no where near what people are worth and for the hours you put in.

job_title: Graphic Designer in Saint George, UT
pros: You get to work on-campus with nice coworkers. The outdoor activities are amazing in St. George, UT. The professors are passionate about what they do and care for the students.
cons: Admin is ridiculous and culture can be right winged. You can't ruffle any feathers without getting backlash. Working around college age students can get frustrating at times.

job_title: Computer Lab Assistant in Saint George, UT
pros: Great work environment, lack of micromanaging, flexible schedules, pay raises annually
cons: Lower pay, non-hostile, intimidating higher ups, strict code of conduct (pro in some cases)

review_title: Worked in 3 different departments while at DSU
job_title: Computer Lab Assistant, Student Admissions Specialist in Saint George, UT
pros: Great place to live. St. George is one of Utah's best cities. If you love the outdoors all year around St. George is your place. DSU is growing which makes it feel like you are apart of something.
cons: Some management is more concerned about letting you know that they are "in charge".

job_title: IT Technician in Saint George, UT

cons: The pay isn't great. If you're only looking for a paycheck then this isn't the place for you.

review_title: Good pay for amount of time worked
